intro: Tococa undabunda, commonly known as the Andean coffee tree, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the cloud forests of northern South America, particularly in Ecuador and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruit, which resembles a small coffee bean, contains a single seed used for propagation. The botanical features of Tococa undabunda make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
